Subject: Re: [neat] Re: Genetic Programming

X-Yahoo-Profile: mattias_fagerlund

> Hey Mattias, I know you also wrote your own GP evolution system.  

I've actually written three or four by now, but the last one was the 
only one that was any good... ;)

> What are you thoughts on "NEATizing" GP?  Do you think it would work 
> out well?

I spent a lot of time thinking about that back when, but I couldn't come 
up with a representation that seemed powerful enough without the 
complexities of infinite recursion and functions with fixed numbers of 
arguments. But I think that NEAT contains a lot of cool ideas that would 
be nice to work into GP.

There are more problems than evolving neural networks that NEAT could 
tackle, though. I'd like to see evolution of electrical circuits using 
NEAT - I have a feeling that it would beat GP hands down.

The reason I think that is that the circuit encoding that Koza et al use 
for their GP runs is similar to Gruaus(?) NN/GP encoding scheme - which 
NEAT beats by an amazing margin. 

cheers,
m
